passage_text: 1 3 After 30 minutes of baking, pour BBQ sauce over ribs, reserving about a cup. 2  Return to oven. 3  Reduce heat to 350° F and bake another 60 minutes (or longer, depending on thickness of ribs), until meat is tender. 4  Baste every 15 minutes while cooking. 1 Set aside. 2  3 After 30 minutes of baking, pour BBQ sauce over ribs, reserving about a cup. 3  Return to oven. 4  Reduce heat to 350° F and bake another 60 minutes (or longer, depending on thickness of ribs), until meat is tender. 5

Instructions. 1  Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. 2  Season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper, then arrange in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish (it will be a tight squeeze). 3  Combine all of the ingredients for the BBQ sauce in a small bowl and stir until smooth. 4  Pour 1/3 of the sauce (about 1/2 cup) over the short ribs. 1

Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake at 300 degrees for about 2-1/2 hours. Remove the foil, pour off some of the cooking liquid and cook for 30 minutes more, or until the short ribs are tender and browned. 1 Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. 2  Season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper, then arrange in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish (it will be a tight squeeze). 3  Combine all of the ingredients for the BBQ sauce in a small bowl and stir until smooth.

1 Double wrap ribs in aluminum foil, place in a 9x13-inch baking dish and bake for 1 1/2 hours in a 350°F oven. 2  Remove ribs from the aluminum foil. 3  Place ribs and sauce in a roaster and bake uncovered for 45 minutes in a 350°F oven. 1 Combine all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a slow boil. 2  Simmer for 45 minutes. 3  Double wrap ribs in aluminum foil, place in a 9x13-inch baking dish and bake for 1 1/2 hours in a 350°F oven. 4

1 Pour over the ribs in the baking dish. 2  Bake ribs in the 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven 45 minutes, or until meat pulls apart easily with a fork and reaches a minimum internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). 1 Preheat the oven broiler. 2  Place ribs on a rack in a broiler pan, and broil on top oven rack 15 minutes, or until well browned. 3  Remove from heat, and transfer to a baking dish. 4  Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175

Directions. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Arrange the short ribs in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish and season with salt and pepper, to taste. In a small bowl, combine all the remaining ingredients and stir to incorporate. Pour the sauce over ribs and toss well, coating all the pieces.

1 Bake ribs in the 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven 45 minutes, or until meat pulls apart easily with a fork and reaches a minimum internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). 1 Preheat the oven broiler. 2  Place ribs on a rack in a broiler pan, and broil on top oven rack 15 minutes, or until well browned. 3  Remove from heat, and transfer to a baking dish. 4  Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175

1 Combine all of the ingredients for the BBQ sauce in a small bowl and stir until smooth. 2  Pour 1/3 of the sauce (about 1/2 cup) over the short ribs. 3  Using tongs, flip the ribs over and spoon another 1/3 of the sauce over top. 4  Reserve the remaining BBQ sauce to spoon over the cooked ribs. 1 Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. 2  Season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper, then arrange in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish (it will be a tight squeeze). 3

1 Season with cinnamon, cloves, and pepper. 2  Bring to a boil. 3  Pour over the ribs in the baking dish. 4  Bake ribs in the 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven 45 minutes, or until meat pulls apart easily with a fork and reaches a minimum internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). 1 Preheat the oven broiler. 2  Place ribs on a rack in a broiler pan, and broil on top oven rack 15 minutes, or until well browned. 3  Remove from heat, and transfer to a baking dish. 4  Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175

1 Place ribs into oven for 1 hour. 2  After one hour, remove foil, turn & baste ribs and bake for 30 minutes. ( 3 If your ribs are on the thicker side you may need to cook for a bit longer). 4  Be sure to baste every 10 minutes during this 30 minute cooking time. 1 (If your ribs are on the thicker side you may need to cook for a bit longer). 2  Be sure to baste every 10 minutes during this 30 minute cooking time. 3  After the 30 minutes are up, turn the oven to BROIL and broil each side for 2-3 minutes. 4  Baste and flip ribs.
